meanings.definition: A loud, high-pitched cry or sound made by a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The piglet's squeals could be heard across the farm.
meanings.sent2: The children's squeals of joy filled the playground.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful squeals always bring a smile to our faces.
meanings.sent4: The squeals of the brakes echoed through the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The squeals of the baby were music to the mother's ears.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, high-pitched cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The toddler squeals with delight when playing with bubbles.
meanings.sent2: The cat squeals when it doesn't want to be picked up.
meanings.sent3: The comedian squeals in mock horror at the bad joke.
meanings.sent4: The kettle squeals as it reaches boiling point.
meanings.sent5: The child squeals with excitement upon seeing the birthday cake.

meanings.definition: A series of short, high-pitched sounds made by brakes or tires.
meanings.sent1: The sudden squeals of the tires indicated an emergency stop.
meanings.sent2: The squeals of the brakes warned of the approaching car.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected squeals of the brakes startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent4: The squeals of the tires on the wet road made the driver nervous.
meanings.sent5: The familiar squeals of the brakes signaled the bus's arrival.
